articles.title: Colo. Sues Trump Admin Over Space Command Move to Alabama
articles.description: Colorado's attorney general sued President Donald Trump's administration on Wednesday for moving U.S. Space Command's headquarters to Alabama.
articles.content:
Colorado's attorney general sued President Donald Trump's administration on Wednesday for moving U.S. Space Command's headquarters to Alabama, calling the decision unconstitutional retaliation for the Democrat state's vote-by-mail practices.
The laws... [1780 chars]

articles.title: Seniors, families brace for the unexpected as SNAP benefits pause for November
articles.description: Michigan Attorney General Dana Nessel and 22 other state attorneys general have filed a lawsuit against the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), demanding the agency use $6 billion in reserve funds to keep SNAP benefits flowing during a federal shutdown.
articles.content: DETROIT – Michigan Attorney General Dana Nessel and 22 other state attorneys general have filed a lawsuit against the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), demanding the agency use $6 billion in reserve funds to keep Supplemental Nutrition Assistanc... [2647 chars]

articles.title: 50 million fentanyl doses seized in Pa. this year, AG Sunday says
articles.description: The attorney general said 27 million of those doses were recovered from the Philadelphia region, where the FBI conducted a large-scale raid in Kensington this month.
articles.content: Marking what they called a “high water mark” in the effort to combat the region’s fentanyl crisis, state and local officials announced Wednesday that they had seized 50 million doses of the deadly synthetic drug in raids across Pennsylvania this year... [3912 chars]

articles.title: Exit poll suggests Dutch election result too close to call, with center-left party slightly ahead
articles.description: An exit poll published immediately after voting ended Wednesday in the Netherlands’ general election suggested the result is too close to call, with the center-left D66 narrowly ahead of the far-right party of anti-Islam lawmaker Geert Wilders
articles.content: THE HAGUE, Netherlands (AP) — An exit poll published immediately after voting ended Wednesday in the Netherlands’ general election suggested the result was too close to call, with the center-left D66 narrowly ahead of the far-right party of anti-Isla... [337 chars]

articles.title: GM lays off thousands of EV workers during Trump crackdown
articles.description: General Motors plans to lay off thousands of workers at electric vehicle facilities across the United States.
articles.content: Battery plants in Ohio and Tennessee, operated with LG Energy Solution, will begin shutting down in January and will resume operations in mid-2026. The automaker also plans to indefinitely lay off 1,200 of the 3,400 workers at its electric vehicle as... [1084 chars]

articles.title: ‘General Hospital,’ ‘Days of Our Lives’ Writer Was 94
articles.description: Margaret DePriest, a head writer on General Hospital, Days of Our Lives, All My Children, Another World and other soaps, has died at 94.
articles.content:
Margaret DePriest, a onetime actress who spent three decades as a pioneering head writer on such soap operas as General Hospital, Days of Our Lives, All My Children and Another World, has died. She was 94.
DePriest died Sept. 29 of natural causes at ... [4376 chars]

articles.title: GM to lay off more than 3,300 employees across 3 states
articles.description: General Motors said Wednesday it's planning to cut more than 3,300 jobs across three states as the electric vehicle industry adjusts to new polices under Trump.
articles.content:
General Motors said Wednesday it’s planning to cut more than 3,300 jobs across three states as the electric vehicle industry adjusts to new polices under President Trump.
The company said about 1,200 employees at its all-electric factory near Detroit... [1504 chars]

articles.title: Baton Rouge officials indicted on conspiracy charges
articles.description: Baton Rouge officials related to BREC and the city's groundwater district have been indicted on state charges of contract conspiracy, trade restraint, and malfeasance in office following an investigation by the Louisiana Attorney General.
articles.content:
The former head of the Baton Rouge area's groundwater protection district and a parish parks agency official were indicted on corruption charges Wednesday.
Gary Beard, 69, who until last month was director of the Capital Area Groundwater Conservation... [982 chars]

articles.title: Michigan House votes to close loophole shielding secretary of state from campaign finance penalties
articles.description: The legislation, approved unanimously, would grant the attorney general power to punish the secretary of state for Michigan Campaign Finance Act violations.
articles.content:
The Michigan House unanimously approved legislation Wednesday that would close a loophole allowing the secretary of state to avoid punishment for campaign finance violations.
